intro: Binghamia acrantha, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and striking plant native to the tropical rainforests of Queensland, Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its unique, bell-shaped flowers that resemble ghostly faces. The plant produces small, yellowish-green fruits that are dispersed by birds. Binghamia acrantha is known for its ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments with high humidity. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
